meico.midi

Class Midi

  • java.lang.Object
    • meico.midi.Midi

  • public class Midi
extends java.lang.Object
    This class holds Midi data and provides som functionality for it.
    Author:
    Axel Berndt.

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      private java.io.File file 
      private javax.sound.midi.Sequence sequence 

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      Midi()
      the most primitive constructor creates an empty MIDI sequence with default PPQ of 720
      Midi(java.io.File midifile)
      this constructor instantiates a Midi object from a midi file
      Midi(int ppq)
      constructor, creates an empty MIDI sequence with the given PPQ timing resolution
      Midi(javax.sound.midi.Sequence sequence)
      constructor, instantiates this class from a midi sequence
      Midi(javax.sound.midi.Sequence sequence, java.io.File midifile)
      constructor, instantiates a Midi object from a sequence and sets the midi file (a possibly existing file is not loaded and writeMidi() will overwrite it)

        public Midi(javax.sound.midi.Sequence sequence,
            java.io.File midifile)

      • append

        public void append(Midi midi)
        Append the provided Midi to this. Differing PPQ will be adapted.
        Parameters:
        midi - the Midi of which the sequence should be appended

      • getPPQ

        public int getPPQ()
           throws java.lang.Exception
        this getter returns the timing resolution of the Midi sequence (in PPQ) or throws an exception if the timing concept is not PPQ
        Returns:
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception

      • convertPPQ

        public void convertPPQ(int ppq)
                throws java.lang.Exception
        This method converts the timing basis, i.e., it sets the new ppq value and converts all events' date accordingly. A new MIDI sequence is created which replaces the old one. If the change should also go into the source file, invoke writeMidi().
        Parameters:
        ppq -
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception

      • getMinimalPPQ

        public int getMinimalPPQ(boolean onlyNotes)
                  throws java.lang.Exception
        computes the minimal integer timing resolution (in pulses per quarter note) necessary for an accurate representation of the MIDI sequence
        Parameters:
        onlyNotes - set false to consider all events; set true to consider only noteOn and noteOff events
        Returns:
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception

      • getMinimalPPQ

        public static int getMinimalPPQ(javax.sound.midi.Sequence sequence,
                                boolean onlyNotes)
                         throws java.lang.Exception
        computes the minimal integer timing resolution (in pulses per quarter note) necessary for an accurate representation of the specified sequence
        Parameters:
        sequence -
        onlyNotes - set false to consider all events; set true to consider only noteOn and noteOff events
        Returns:
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception

      • noteOns2NoteOffs

        public int noteOns2NoteOffs()
        In MIDI noteOff events are often encoded as notOn events with velocity 0. With this method these events are converted to real noteOffs. The sequence to be altered is this Midi object's sequence.
        Returns:
        the number of events changed

      • noteOns2NoteOffs

        public static int noteOns2NoteOffs(javax.sound.midi.Sequence sequence)
        In MIDI noteOff events are often encoded as notOn events with velocity 0. With this method these events are converted to real noteOffs.
        Parameters:
        sequence - the sequence to be altered
        Returns:
        the number of events changed

      • noteOffs2NoteOns

        public int noteOffs2NoteOns()
        In MIDI noteOff events are often encoded as notOn events with velocity 0. With this method noteOffs are replaced by noteOns. The sequence to be altered is this Midi object's sequence.
        Returns:
        the number of events changed

      • noteOffs2NoteOns

        public static int noteOffs2NoteOns(javax.sound.midi.Sequence sequence)
        In MIDI noteOff events are often encoded as notOn events with velocity 0. With this method noteOffs are replaced by noteOns.
        Parameters:
        sequence - the sequence to be altered
        Returns:
        the number of events changed

      • writeMidi

        public boolean writeMidi()
        write the sequence to a midi file; this overwrites the midi file indicated by attribute file (must be != null)
        Returns:
        true if success, false if an error occurred

        this is an audio exporter that uses the specified soundbank or, if null, the default soundbank for synthesis

        public Msm exportMsm(boolean useDefaultInstrumentNames,
                     boolean cleanup)
        convert the MIDI data to MSM
        Parameters:
        cleanup - set true to return a clean msm file or false to keep all the crap from the conversion process

        Returns:
